sites.name: Catedral de Sevilla
sites.description: The Cathedral of Seville is the largest Gothic cathedral in the world and a UNESCO World Heritage site. Built on the site of a former mosque, it features the iconic Giralda bell tower, which was originally a minaret. The cathedral houses Christopher Columbus's tomb and numerous works of art, including paintings by Murillo and Goya. Its stunning architecture combines Gothic, Renaissance, and Baroque elements.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Summer brings intense heat, making early morning visits essential. Spring and autumn offer ideal temperatures. Winter provides fewer crowds. Special religious celebrations may affect access. The cathedral's interior provides relief from extreme weather.
sites.booking_tips: Online tickets recommended to avoid queues. Audio guides available in multiple languages. Guided tours offer deeper insights. Photography permitted in most areas. Combined tickets with Alcázar available. Free entry on Mondays 4:30-6 PM.

sites.name: Real Alcázar de Sevilla
sites.description: The Royal Alcázar of Seville is a stunning palace complex that combines Islamic and Christian architecture. Built over several centuries, it features beautiful gardens, intricate tilework, and ornate rooms. The palace is still used by the Spanish royal family as their official residence in Seville. The gardens are particularly noteworthy, with their fountains, pavilions, and exotic plants.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Summer heat makes early morning visits essential. Spring brings beautiful garden blooms. Autumn offers pleasant temperatures. Winter provides fewer crowds. Gardens are most spectacular in spring and early summer.
sites.booking_tips: Online tickets strongly recommended. Guided tours available in multiple languages. Photography permitted in most areas. Comfortable walking shoes recommended. Combined tickets with Cathedral available. Free entry on Mondays 4-5 PM.

sites.name: Plaza de España
sites.description: Plaza de España is a magnificent square built for the 1929 Ibero-American Exposition. The semi-circular building features a canal with bridges representing Spain's provinces, and the square is decorated with beautiful tilework and fountains. The architecture combines Renaissance and Moorish Revival styles, creating a stunning backdrop for photos and leisurely walks.
sites.seasonal_notes: Accessible year-round. Summer evenings bring relief from heat. Spring and autumn offer ideal temperatures. Winter provides fewer crowds. The square is particularly beautiful at sunset. Special events and performances throughout the year.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required for general access. Rowboat rentals available on the canal. Multiple entrances provide convenient access. Comfortable walking shoes recommended. Photography popular throughout the day. Located near Maria Luisa Park.

sites.name: Barrio de Santa Cruz
sites.description: The Santa Cruz neighborhood is Seville's historic Jewish quarter, featuring narrow winding streets, whitewashed buildings, and charming plazas. This picturesque area is filled with restaurants, tapas bars, and shops, offering a perfect blend of history and modern life. The neighborhood's intimate atmosphere and beautiful architecture make it a favorite among visitors.
sites.seasonal_notes: Accessible year-round. Summer evenings bring outdoor dining and street performers. Spring and autumn offer pleasant temperatures. Winter brings holiday decorations. The narrow streets provide shade during hot days. Special events and festivals throughout the year.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Guided walking tours available. Comfortable walking shoes essential. Many restaurants and tapas bars to explore. Street performers common in good weather. Located near major attractions.

sites.name: Torre del Oro
sites.description: The Torre del Oro (Golden Tower) is a 13th-century military watchtower on the Guadalquivir River. Originally part of the city's defensive walls, it now houses a maritime museum. The tower's distinctive golden color and strategic location make it one of Seville's most recognizable landmarks.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Summer brings river cruises and increased visitors. Spring and autumn offer pleasant temperatures. Winter provides fewer crowds. The tower's location by the river provides nice views year-round.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Small museum inside. Photography permitted. Combined tickets with river cruises available. Located near the river for easy access. Guided tours available.

sites.name: Parque de María Luisa
sites.description: Maria Luisa Park is Seville's most famous park, featuring beautiful gardens, fountains, and historic pavilions. Created for the 1929 Ibero-American Exposition, it offers a peaceful escape from the city's heat and bustle. The park includes the Plaza de América and various museums, making it both a recreational and cultural destination.
sites.seasonal_notes: Accessible year-round. Spring brings blooming flowers and pleasant temperatures. Summer offers shade and relief from heat. Autumn features beautiful fall colors. Winter provides clear views and fewer crowds. Special events and performances throughout the year.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Multiple entrances provide convenient access. Comfortable walking shoes recommended. Park maps available. Street performers and artists common in good weather. Located near Plaza de España.

sites.name: Museo de Bellas Artes
sites.description: The Museum of Fine Arts of Seville is one of Spain's most important art galleries, housed in a former convent. The collection focuses on Spanish Baroque art, particularly works by Murillo and Zurbarán. The building itself is a work of art, with its beautiful courtyards and architectural details.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round with climate-controlled galleries. Less crowded on weekday mornings. Free entry for EU citizens. Special exhibitions rotate seasonally. Summer brings extended hours. The museum's central location makes it easily accessible in any weather.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required for general access. Audio guides available. Guided tours offer deeper insights. Photography permitted in most areas. Museum café offers pleasant courtyard seating. Combined tickets with other museums available.

sites.name: Metropol Parasol
sites.description: Metropol Parasol, also known as 'Las Setas' (The Mushrooms), is a modern wooden structure in the heart of Seville. Built in 2011, it features a walkway with panoramic views of the city, an archaeological museum, and a market. The structure's unique design has made it a modern icon of Seville.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Evening views particularly spectacular. Summer brings longer hours and increased visitors. Winter offers clearer views but shorter hours. Spring and autumn provide ideal visiting conditions. The structure provides shade during hot days.
sites.booking_tips: Online tickets recommended for the walkway. Photography permitted. Comfortable walking shoes recommended. Archaeological museum located below. Market open during day. Located in central Seville.

sites.name: Triana
sites.description: Triana is a historic neighborhood across the Guadalquivir River, known for its traditional ceramics, flamenco culture, and vibrant atmosphere. The area features colorful streets, local markets, and authentic tapas bars. It's also famous for its traditional tile-making workshops and flamenco venues.
sites.seasonal_notes: Accessible year-round. Summer evenings bring outdoor dining and street performers. Spring and autumn offer pleasant temperatures. Winter brings holiday decorations. The neighborhood's riverside location provides nice views year-round.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Guided walking tours available. Comfortable walking shoes essential. Many restaurants and tapas bars to explore. Street performers common in good weather. Accessible by bridge from city center.

sites.name: Archivo de Indias
sites.description: The Archive of the Indies is a historic building housing documents relating to Spain's colonial history in the Americas. The building itself is a Renaissance masterpiece, and the archive contains millions of documents, including maps, letters, and official records from the colonial period.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round with climate-controlled reading rooms. Less crowded on weekday mornings. Special exhibitions rotate seasonally. Summer brings extended hours. The building's central location makes it easily accessible in any weather.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required for general access. Guided tours available. Photography permitted in designated areas. Research access requires advance registration. Located near the Cathedral.

sites.name: Plaza de Toros de la Maestranza
sites.description: The Maestranza Bullring is one of Spain's most historic and beautiful bullrings. Built in the 18th century, it features a distinctive Baroque facade and houses a museum about bullfighting history. The bullring is still active during the bullfighting season.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round for tours. Bullfighting season runs March-October. Summer brings peak tourist crowds. Spring and autumn offer pleasant temperatures. Winter provides fewer visitors. Special events may affect access.
sites.booking_tips: Online tickets recommended for tours. Photography permitted in museum. Guided tours available. Check schedule for bullfighting events. Located near the river.

sites.name: Museo del Baile Flamenco
sites.description: The Flamenco Dance Museum offers an interactive experience about flamenco culture and history. The museum features exhibits about flamenco's origins, costumes, and instruments, and hosts live performances in its intimate theater.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Evening performances most popular. Summer brings increased visitors. Winter offers fewer crowds. Special performances throughout the year. The museum's central location makes it easily accessible.
sites.booking_tips: Online tickets recommended for performances. Photography permitted in most areas. Guided tours available. Check schedule for live shows. Located in historic building.

sites.name: Isla Mágica
sites.description: Isla Mágica is a theme park themed around Spain's Age of Discovery. Located on the site of the 1992 World Expo, it features rides, shows, and attractions based on historical themes. The park combines entertainment with educational elements about Spain's colonial history.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open March-December. Summer brings peak crowds and heat. Spring and autumn offer pleasant temperatures. Winter provides fewer visitors. Special events and shows throughout the season.
sites.booking_tips: Online tickets recommended. Check opening hours by season. Some attractions may close in bad weather. Located outside city center. Multiple transportation options available.

sites.name: Palacio de las Dueñas
sites.description: The Palace of the Dukes of Alba is a beautiful 15th-century palace featuring Mudéjar architecture, gardens, and art collections. The palace combines Gothic, Renaissance, and Islamic architectural elements, creating a unique historical experience.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Summer heat makes early morning visits essential. Spring brings beautiful garden blooms. Autumn offers pleasant temperatures. Winter provides fewer crowds. Gardens are most spectacular in spring.
sites.booking_tips: Online tickets recommended. Guided tours available. Photography permitted in most areas. Comfortable walking shoes recommended. Located in historic district.

sites.name: Museo Arqueológico
sites.description: The Archaeological Museum of Seville houses artifacts from prehistoric times to the modern era, with a special focus on Roman and Islamic periods. The museum is located in a beautiful neoclassical building in Maria Luisa Park.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round with climate-controlled galleries. Less crowded on weekday mornings. Free entry for EU citizens. Special exhibitions rotate seasonally. Summer brings extended hours.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required for general access. Audio guides available. Guided tours offer deeper insights. Photography permitted in most areas. Located in Maria Luisa Park.

sites.name: Parque del Alamillo
sites.description: Alamillo Park is a large urban park offering extensive green spaces, walking trails, and recreational activities. The park features a lake, sports facilities, and areas for picnics, making it a popular destination for locals and visitors seeking outdoor activities.
sites.seasonal_notes: Accessible year-round. Summer mornings and evenings most pleasant. Spring and autumn offer ideal temperatures. Winter provides fewer crowds. The park's size makes it suitable for various activities in any season.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Multiple entrances available. Comfortable walking shoes recommended. Sports equipment rentals available. Located outside city center.

neighborhoods.name: Santa Cruz
neighborhoods.character: Seville's historic heart featuring narrow winding streets, whitewashed buildings, and traditional Andalusian architecture, with a mix of historic sites, tapas bars, and tourist attractions.

location.description: Located in the heart of Seville, bordered by the Cathedral and Alcázar to the north, and encompassing the historic Jewish quarter.

history.overview: Originally the Jewish quarter during medieval times, later becoming a residential area for nobility, with significant development during the Renaissance and Baroque periods.
history.significance: The historical and cultural heart of Seville, showcasing the city's multicultural past and architectural heritage.

practical_info.safety: Very safe during day and evening; normal precautions regarding pickpockets in tourist areas.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Morning for historic sites; evening for dining and atmosphere.
practical_info.walkability: Excellent - predominantly pedestrianized with limited vehicle access.

attractions.name: Seville Cathedral
attractions.description: Largest Gothic cathedral in the world, featuring the Giralda tower and Christopher Columbus's tomb.
attractions.appeal: Experience the grandeur of Spanish religious architecture and history.

attractions.name: Real Alcázar
attractions.description: UNESCO World Heritage site featuring stunning Mudéjar architecture and historic gardens.
attractions.appeal: Explore centuries of architectural history in a living royal palace.

attractions.name: Plaza de los Venerables
attractions.description: Charming square surrounded by historic buildings and traditional restaurants.
attractions.appeal: Immerse yourself in Seville's historic atmosphere while enjoying local cuisine.

dining.name: La Azotea
dining.known_for: Creative tapas and excellent wine selection
dining.atmosphere: Modern rooftop dining with city views.

activities.name: Historic Walking Tour
activities.description: Guided or self-guided tour through Seville's historic streets and squares.

activities.name: Tapas Tour
activities.description: Explore traditional tapas bars and local specialties.

stay_here_if: You want to be within walking distance of main attractions.
You enjoy historic surroundings and cultural activities.
You prefer to immerse yourself in the heart of the city.
avoid_if: You're sensitive to noise (streets can be busy, especially during festivals).
You prefer modern accommodations with spacious rooms.
You're looking for a quiet, residential experience.
insider_tips: Visit the Cathedral and Alcázar early morning to avoid crowds.
Many tapas bars offer free tapas with drinks during happy hour.
The area's side streets often hide the best traditional bars.

neighborhoods.name: Triana
neighborhoods.character: Historic neighborhood across the Guadalquivir River, known for its ceramic workshops, flamenco heritage, and traditional atmosphere.

location.description: Located across the Guadalquivir River from the city center, connected by historic bridges.

history.overview: Originally a working-class district known for its ceramic workshops and flamenco culture, with significant development during the 19th and 20th centuries.
history.significance: Represents Seville's traditional crafts and cultural heritage, particularly in ceramics and flamenco.

practical_info.safety: Very safe area with good lighting and regular police presence.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Morning for markets and workshops; evening for dining and atmosphere.
practical_info.walkability: Excellent with pedestrian-friendly streets and riverfront promenade.

attractions.name: Mercado de Triana
attractions.description: Historic market featuring fresh produce, seafood, and local specialties.
attractions.appeal: Experience local market culture and sample fresh ingredients.

attractions.name: Calle Betis
attractions.description: Historic street along the Guadalquivir with traditional bars and restaurants.
attractions.appeal: Enjoy riverside dining and traditional atmosphere.

attractions.name: Ceramic Workshops
attractions.description: Historic ceramic workshops producing traditional Seville tiles.
attractions.appeal: Watch traditional ceramic craftsmen at work.

activities.name: Ceramic Workshop Tour
activities.description: Visit traditional ceramic workshops and learn about the craft.

activities.name: Flamenco Experience
activities.description: Watch authentic flamenco performances in traditional venues.

stay_here_if: You enjoy traditional crafts and culture.
You prefer a mix of tourist and local life.
avoid_if: You want to be closer to main tourist attractions.
You're sensitive to noise at night.
insider_tips: Visit ceramic workshops in the morning when craftsmen are working.
Many bars offer free flamenco shows in the evening.
The riverside promenade is perfect for evening walks.

neighborhoods.name: El Arenal
neighborhoods.character: Historic neighborhood known for its bullfighting heritage, traditional atmosphere, and mix of historic sites and modern amenities.

location.description: Located between the Guadalquivir River and the historic center, featuring historic streets and modern developments.
landmarks: Plaza de Toros de la Maestranza

history.overview: Originally a port area during the city's maritime golden age, later becoming associated with bullfighting and traditional culture.
history.significance: Represents Seville's maritime history and traditional bullfighting culture.

transit: Plaza de la Maestranza tram stop
practical_info.safety: Generally safe; normal urban precautions advised at night.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Morning for historic sites; evening for dining and atmosphere.
practical_info.walkability: Excellent with pedestrian-friendly streets and riverfront promenade.

attractions.name: Plaza de Toros de la Maestranza
attractions.description: Historic bullring with museum and guided tours.
attractions.appeal: Learn about Seville's bullfighting tradition and history.

attractions.name: Torre del Oro
attractions.appeal: Explore Seville's maritime history and enjoy river views.

attractions.name: Plaza de la Maestranza
attractions.description: Historic square surrounded by traditional buildings.

activities.name: Bullring Tour
activities.description: Guided tour of the historic bullring and museum.

activities.name: Riverside Walk
activities.description: Stroll along the Guadalquivir River and visit historic sites.

stay_here_if: You want to be near historic sites and traditional atmosphere.
You enjoy traditional dining and nightlife.
You prefer a mix of tourist and local life.
avoid_if: You're sensitive to noise at night.
You want to be closer to main tourist attractions.
insider_tips: Visit the bullring early morning to avoid crowds.
Many restaurants offer traditional lunch menus at reduced prices.
The riverside promenade is perfect for evening walks.

fine_dining.name: Abantal
signature_dishes: Red Prawns with Seaweed and Citrus
fine_dining.atmosphere: Elegant dining room with modern decor and intimate atmosphere
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book 2-3 weeks in advance, especially for weekend dining
fine_dining.local_tips: Chef Julio Fernández's tasting menu showcases modern Andalusian cuisine with innovative techniques

fine_dining.name: La Azotea
fine_dining.atmosphere: Modern rooftop dining with city views
fine_dining.booking_tips: Reserve 1-2 weeks in advance, closed Mondays
fine_dining.local_tips: Known for creative tapas and excellent wine selection

fine_dining.name: Eslava
signature_dishes: Slow-cooked Egg with Mushroom and Truffle
fine_dining.atmosphere: Contemporary dining room with open kitchen
fine_dining.local_tips: Award-winning tapas with innovative twists on traditional dishes

fine_dining.name: Cañabota
fine_dining.atmosphere: Modern seafood restaurant with counter seating
fine_dining.local_tips: Specializes in fresh seafood and traditional fish preparations

fine_dining.name: La Brunilda
fine_dining.atmosphere: Cozy dining room with modern decor
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book 1 week ahead, closed Sundays and Mondays
fine_dining.local_tips: Creative tapas with excellent value for money

casual_dining.name: El Rinconcillo
casual_dining.booking_tips: Book for sit-down meals, especially for weekend lunches
casual_dining.local_tips: Seville's oldest bar since 1670; perfect for traditional tapas

casual_dining.name: La Casa del Flamenco
casual_dining.booking_tips: Book for dinner and flamenco show
casual_dining.local_tips: Combines traditional cuisine with authentic flamenco performances

casual_dining.name: Bar Alfalfa
casual_dining.local_tips: Popular local spot with excellent traditional tapas

casual_dining.name: La Bodega
casual_dining.local_tips: Famous for its montaditos and local atmosphere

casual_dining.name: Taberna Coloniales
casual_dining.local_tips: Historic tavern with excellent traditional dishes

street_food.name: Mercado de Triana
street_food.local_tips: Historic market with fresh local produce and seafood; perfect for sampling local specialties

street_food.name: Mercado de la Encarnación
street_food.local_tips: Modern market with gourmet food stalls and local specialties

street_food.name: Churrería La Centuria
street_food.local_tips: Historic churros institution; perfect for traditional breakfast

street_food.name: La Campana
street_food.local_tips: Historic pastry shop since 1885; famous for traditional Spanish sweets

street_food.name: Bar El Comercio
street_food.local_tips: Historic bar since 1904; famous for its traditional tapas and local atmosphere

coffee_shops.name: Café de Indias
coffee_shops.local_tips: Excellent specialty coffee and homemade cakes

coffee_shops.name: Café Virgen
coffee_shops.local_tips: Popular with digital nomads; excellent brunch options

coffee_shops.name: Café Baraka
coffee_shops.local_tips: Focus on healthy and organic options

coffee_shops.name: Café de la Prensa
coffee_shops.local_tips: Historic café with traditional Spanish breakfast

coffee_shops.name: Café del Art
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Art gallery café with contemporary decor
coffee_shops.local_tips: Combines contemporary art with specialty coffee

bars.name: El Garlochi
bars.local_tips: Unique religious-themed bar with excellent sherry selection

bars.name: La Alacena
bars.atmosphere: Cozy wine bar with eclectic decor
bars.local_tips: Specializes in natural and local wines

bars.name: La Carbonería
bars.local_tips: Free flamenco shows in historic setting

bars.name: La Bodeguita
bars.local_tips: Popular local spot with excellent traditional tapas

bars.name: La Antigua Bodeguita
bars.local_tips: Historic bar with excellent traditional atmosphere

food_tours.name: Seville Tapas Tour
food_tours.booking_tips: Book at least a week in advance; tours explain the history of tapas culture

food_tours.name: Triana Market Tour
food_tours.booking_tips: Morning tours recommended when market is most active

food_tours.name: Sherry Wine Tour
food_tours.booking_tips: Book 1-2 weeks ahead; includes transportation between venues

cooking_classes.name: Andalusian Cooking Workshop
includes: Market visit, all ingredients, recipes, full meal with wine
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Reserve 1-2 weeks ahead; begins with shopping at local market

cooking_classes.name: Tapas Masterclass
includes: All ingredients, recipe booklet, full meal with wine
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Book at least 5 days in advance; great for groups

markets.name: Mercado de Triana
markets.local_tips: Historic market with fresh local produce and seafood; perfect for sampling local specialties

markets.name: Mercado de la Encarnación
markets.local_tips: Modern market with gourmet food stalls and local specialties

markets.name: Mercado de Feria
markets.local_tips: Traditional market in historic neighborhood; less touristy than other markets

spring: Habas con Jamón (Broad Beans with Ham)

destinations.whyGo: Visit this historic city famous for its stunning Mezquita-Catedral, Roman bridge, and charming Jewish quarter. The city was once the capital of Islamic Spain and is rich in cultural heritage.
Explore this historic city featuring the stunning Alhambra palace complex, historic Albaicín quarter, and authentic flamenco scene. The city offers a perfect blend of Islamic and Christian heritage.
Visit this vibrant coastal city with its Picasso Museum, historic Alcazaba, and beautiful beaches. The city offers a perfect blend of culture and Mediterranean lifestyle.
Experience Europe's oldest continuously inhabited city with its historic old town, beautiful beaches, and unique atmosphere. The city offers stunning coastal views and rich maritime history.
Discover this historic city famous for its sherry wine, equestrian traditions, and flamenco culture. The city offers authentic Andalusian experiences and world-renowned wine cellars.
Visit Spain's vibrant capital with its world-class museums, historic architecture, and dynamic cultural scene.
Experience Catalonia's vibrant capital with its distinctive Gaudí architecture, Mediterranean beaches, and renowned cuisine.
Discover Spain's third-largest city with its futuristic City of Arts and Sciences, historic old town, and beautiful beaches.
Visit the Basque Country's largest city with its iconic Guggenheim Museum, historic old town, and renowned culinary scene.
Experience the iconic City of Light with its world-famous landmarks, unparalleled museums, and legendary culinary scene.
Explore one of the world's most dynamic cities with its historic landmarks, cultural diversity, and cutting-edge arts scene.
Discover the Eternal City with its ancient ruins, Renaissance masterpieces, and vibrant street life.
Experience the Netherlands' vibrant capital with its iconic canals, world-class museums, and distinctive architecture.
Discover Germany's dynamic capital with its turbulent history, cutting-edge arts scene, and legendary nightlife.
Visit Portugal's captivating capital with its historic trams, Fado music, and beautiful hillside setting on the Tagus River.
Experience Portugal's second city with its historic port wine cellars, beautiful riverside setting, and distinctive architecture.
Visit Italy's fashion and design capital with its stunning cathedral, historic architecture, and world-class shopping.
Explore Austria's imperial capital with its magnificent palaces, classical music heritage, and elegant coffee house culture.
Discover the Czech Republic's capital with its stunning medieval architecture, historic castle, and vibrant cultural scene.

activities.name: Semana Santa (Holy Week)
activities.description: Experience Seville's world-famous Holy Week processions, featuring ornate religious floats (pasos), traditional music, and dramatic religious imagery through the historic streets.
activities.seasonal_notes: Dates vary each year (March-April) with processions throughout Holy Week, particularly impressive on Holy Thursday and Good Friday. Seville's processions are among the most elaborate in Spain.
activities.booking_tips: Book accommodation months in advance. Arrive early to secure viewing spots along the official routes. Plaza de San Francisco and Avenida de la Constitución offer good vantage points.

activities.name: Feria de Abril (April Fair)
activities.description: Experience Seville's most famous festival, featuring traditional flamenco dresses, horse parades, fairground attractions, and casetas (tents) with food and drink.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held two weeks after Holy Week, this week-long celebration transforms the city with traditional Andalusian culture and festivities.
activities.booking_tips: Book accommodation months in advance. Many casetas are private but some are public. Arrive early for the daily horse parade.

activities.name: Alcázar Spring Gardens
activities.description: Explore the stunning spring blooms in the Real Alcázar's historic gardens, featuring fountains, orange trees, and seasonal flower displays.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring (April-May) brings spectacular blooms, particularly in the English Garden and around the Mercury Pond. The gardens are at their most beautiful during this season.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online in advance. Arrive early to avoid crowds. Weekday mornings offer the most peaceful experience.

activities.name: Seville Marathon
activities.description: Participate in or watch Seville's annual marathon, which takes runners through the city's most iconic landmarks and streets.
activities.price_range: Free to watch, Moderate to participate
activities.seasonal_notes: Held in February, offering ideal running conditions with mild temperatures and clear skies.
activities.booking_tips: Register months in advance if participating. Spectators can watch from various points along the route; Plaza de España offers a great vantage point.

activities.name: Seville Flamenco Biennial
activities.description: Experience one of Spain's most important flamenco festivals, featuring performances, workshops, and cultural events.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held every two years in spring, showcasing the best of flamenco music and dance.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online when the program is announced. Popular performances sell out quickly.

activities.name: Seville Cocktail Week
activities.description: Sample creative cocktails from Seville's best bars during this week-long celebration of mixology.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held in May, featuring special cocktail menus and events at participating bars throughout the city.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase a wristband for access to special events and discounted cocktails. Some events require advance booking.

activities.name: Seville Design Festival
activities.description: Experience exhibitions, installations, and events celebrating design in all its forms across various venues in Seville.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring edition focuses on contemporary design with exhibitions, workshops, and talks throughout the city.
activities.booking_tips: Check the festival website for program details. Some events require advance registration.

activities.name: Spring Art Week
activities.description: Visit galleries and art spaces participating in this city-wide celebration of contemporary art.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held in May, featuring special exhibitions and events at galleries throughout Seville.
activities.booking_tips: Download the official map of participating venues. Many galleries offer extended hours during the festival.

activities.name: Noche en Blanco (White Night)
activities.description: Experience Seville's annual cultural night festival, featuring extended hours at museums, galleries, and cultural venues.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held in June, transforming the city with cultural activities and special events throughout the night.
activities.booking_tips: Check the program in advance. Some venues may require advance registration.

activities.name: Seville Pride
activities.description: Join one of Andalusia's largest LGBTQ+ celebrations featuring parades, concerts, and cultural events.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held in June, transforming the city with rainbow colors and celebrations.
activities.booking_tips: Book accommodation months in advance. Many events are free but some parties require tickets.

activities.name: Veranos de Sevilla
activities.description: Enjoy open-air concerts, theater performances, and cultural events in various venues across Seville.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer-long festival offering cultural entertainment in outdoor venues throughout the city.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online when the program is announced. Popular events sell out quickly.

activities.name: Guadalquivir River Activities
activities.description: Enjoy river activities including boat tours, kayaking, and riverside events along the Guadalquivir.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer brings various activities and events to the river, including sunset cruises and water sports.
activities.booking_tips: Book boat tours in advance. Early morning or evening activities are recommended to avoid heat.

activities.name: Seville Foodie Week
activities.description: Sample special menus and culinary events at participating restaurants throughout the city.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer edition features special menus and culinary events showcasing Seville's dining scene.
activities.booking_tips: Reserve tables in advance at participating restaurants. Special menus often require advance booking.

activities.name: Seville Jazz Festival
activities.description: Experience jazz performances in various venues across the city, from intimate clubs to outdoor stages.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer brings jazz performances to various venues, including outdoor concerts in parks.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online for specific performances. Some venues offer season passes.

activities.name: Seville's Rooftop Bars
activities.description: Enjoy drinks and views at Seville's rooftop bars, which come alive during summer evenings.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer evenings offer perfect conditions for rooftop dining and drinking with spectacular city views.
activities.booking_tips: Reserve tables in advance, especially for sunset views. Popular spots include Doña María Hotel and Hotel Alfonso XIII.

activities.name: Seville's Summer Sales
activities.description: Take advantage of summer sales at major shopping areas including Calle Sierpes and various malls.
activities.seasonal_notes: Major sales begin in July with significant discounts at stores throughout the city.
activities.booking_tips: Visit early in the morning to avoid crowds. Many stores offer online shopping with in-store pickup.

activities.name: Seville's Summer Cinema
activities.description: Watch movies under the stars at various outdoor cinema venues throughout the city.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer brings outdoor cinema screenings to various locations, including parks and cultural centers.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online in advance. Bring blankets or chairs for comfortable viewing.

activities.name: Seville International Film Festival
activities.description: Experience one of Spain's most important film festivals, featuring premieres, retrospectives, and special events.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held in November, showcasing international and Spanish cinema with red carpet events and screenings.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online when the program is announced. Popular screenings sell out quickly.

activities.name: Seville Wine Week
activities.description: Sample wines from across Andalusia at various events and tastings throughout the city.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn brings wine-focused events and tastings, celebrating Andalusia's wine culture.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets for specific tastings in advance. Many events require advance registration.

activities.name: Seville Fashion Week
activities.description: Experience Andalusia's premier fashion event, featuring runway shows and industry events.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn edition showcases upcoming spring/summer collections with various events and shows.
activities.booking_tips: Tickets are primarily for industry professionals, but some events are open to the public with advance booking.

activities.name: Seville's Autumn Parks
activities.description: Enjoy the autumn colors in Seville's parks, particularly María Luisa Park and Alamillo Park.
activities.seasonal_notes: October-November brings beautiful autumn colors to Seville's parks and gardens.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required; visit on weekdays for fewer crowds. Early morning offers the best light for photography.

activities.name: Seville's Autumn Gastronomy
activities.description: Sample seasonal dishes and participate in food events celebrating autumn ingredients.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn brings seasonal specialties including mushrooms, game, and traditional stews.
activities.booking_tips: Reserve tables at participating restaurants. Many offer special autumn tasting menus.

activities.name: Seville's Autumn Art Exhibitions
activities.description: Visit major art exhibitions at Seville's museums and galleries during the autumn season.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn brings major exhibitions to Seville's museums, including the Museum of Fine Arts and CAAC.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online in advance. Many museums offer combined tickets for multiple exhibitions.

activities.name: Seville's Autumn Theater Season
activities.description: Attend performances at Seville's theaters as the new season begins.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn marks the beginning of the theater season with new productions and performances.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online in advance. Many theaters offer season subscriptions.

activities.name: Seville's Autumn Markets
activities.description: Browse seasonal products at various markets throughout the city.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn brings seasonal products and special markets featuring local produce and crafts.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required; arrive early for the best selection. Many markets offer guided tours.

activities.name: Seville's Autumn Music Scene
activities.description: Enjoy concerts and performances at various venues throughout the city.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn brings various music events and performances to Seville's concert halls and venues.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online in advance. Many venues offer season subscriptions.

activities.name: Christmas Lights in Seville
activities.description: Experience Seville's spectacular Christmas light displays along major streets and squares.
activities.seasonal_notes: Displayed from late November through early January, with synchronized light shows and festive decorations.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required; shows typically run from 6pm to midnight. Most crowded on weekends and holidays.

activities.name: Three Kings Parade (Cabalgata de Reyes)
activities.description: Witness the traditional Three Kings parade through Seville's streets on January 5th.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held on January 5th, featuring elaborate floats and candy distribution to children.
activities.booking_tips: Arrive early for good viewing spots along the route. Bring bags for collecting candy.

activities.name: Seville's Christmas Markets
activities.description: Browse traditional Christmas markets throughout the city, particularly in Plaza Nueva.
activities.seasonal_notes: Open from late November through December, featuring traditional crafts and holiday items.
activities.booking_tips: Visit on weekdays to avoid crowds. Plaza Nueva's market is the most traditional.

activities.name: Seville's Winter Museums
activities.description: Explore Seville's world-class museums during the quieter winter season.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter offers fewer crowds and special exhibitions at Seville's major museums.
activities.booking_tips: Many museums offer free entry on certain days. Check schedules for special winter hours.

activities.name: Seville's Winter Gastronomy
activities.description: Sample traditional winter dishes and seasonal specialties at restaurants throughout the city.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter brings traditional dishes like rabo de toro and seasonal specialties.
activities.booking_tips: Reserve tables in advance, especially for traditional restaurants. Many offer special winter menus.

activities.name: Seville's Winter Theater
activities.description: Attend performances at Seville's theaters during the winter season.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter brings various performances and productions to Seville's theaters.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online in advance. Many theaters offer winter season subscriptions.

activities.name: Seville's Winter Parks
activities.description: Enjoy Seville's parks during the quieter winter season, particularly María Luisa Park.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter offers peaceful walks and unique perspectives of Seville's parks.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required; visit on sunny days for the best experience.

activities.name: Seville's Winter Shopping
activities.description: Take advantage of winter sales and shopping opportunities throughout the city.
activities.seasonal_notes: January brings major sales with significant discounts at stores throughout Seville.
activities.booking_tips: Visit early in the morning to avoid crowds. Many stores offer online shopping with in-store pickup.

activities.name: Seville's Winter Sports
activities.description: Watch winter sports events or participate in indoor sports activities.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter brings various sports events and activities to Seville's venues.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online in advance for specific events. Many venues offer winter sports packages.

ranges.notes: New Year's Day celebrations in Plaza Nueva. Public holiday.
Off-season with fewer tourists and good hotel value. Mild winter climate with daytime temperatures around 15°C.
Three Kings celebration features a spectacular parade through central Seville and marks the main gift-giving tradition in Spain. January 6 is a public holiday.
Winter sales begin mid-January in all shops and department stores. Museums and cultural venues are less crowded.
Still relatively quiet tourist season with mild winter temperatures. Good time for cultural visits and indoor activities.
Annual marathon taking runners through the city's most iconic landmarks and streets. Spectators can watch from various points along the route.
Early spring with warming temperatures. Orange trees begin to blossom throughout the city.
Major design event featuring exhibitions, installations, and events celebrating contemporary design across various venues.
Spring in full swing with warming temperatures and blossoming orange trees. Excellent time for outdoor activities and museum visits.
Prime spring conditions with pleasant temperatures ideal for sightseeing.

ranges.event: Semana Santa (Holy Week - varies by year)
ranges.notes: Seville's world-famous Holy Week processions are among the most elaborate in Spain, featuring ornate religious floats (pasos), traditional music, and dramatic religious imagery through historic streets. Particularly impressive on Holy Thursday and Good Friday.
Transition period between major festivals. City cleaning and preparation for Feria.
Seville's most famous festival, featuring traditional flamenco dresses, horse parades, fairground attractions, and casetas (tents) with food and drink. Held two weeks after Holy Week.
Excellent spring weather continues with longer days and perfect temperatures for outdoor exploration.
Public holiday with events throughout the city. Many locals head to parks for picnics and celebrations.
Excellent time to visit with perfect temperatures. Outdoor dining becomes especially pleasant with all restaurant terraces open.
One of Spain's most important flamenco festivals, featuring performances, workshops, and cultural events.
Spring festivals and cultural events throughout the city. Temperatures warm but still comfortable for sightseeing.
Early summer brings consistent warm weather ideal for outdoor activities and dining. Crowds build gradually but not yet at peak season levels.
Annual cultural night festival featuring extended hours at museums, galleries, and cultural venues throughout the city.
Summer tourism season begins with longer days and warm evenings perfect for outdoor dining.
Peak summer season begins with hot temperatures. Early morning and evening activities recommended.
Summer-long cultural festival featuring open-air concerts, theater performances, and cultural events in various venues across Seville.
Hot summer weather with many businesses closed for holidays. Many locals leave the city.
Traditional festival honoring Seville's patron saint. Public holiday with special services and processions.
Good hotel deals available but some restaurants and shops may be closed. Hot days with warm nights good for evening activities.
Excellent time to visit as summer crowds diminish but weather remains warm. Cultural season begins with new exhibitions and performances.
Andalusia's premier fashion event featuring runway shows and industry events. Some events open to the public with advance booking.
Perfect temperatures for sightseeing with warm days and pleasant evenings. Full cultural calendar of events.
Excellent autumn weather with warm days perfect for sightseeing. Cultural season in full swing with major exhibitions and performances.
National holiday commemorating Columbus's arrival in the Americas, with military parades and events in central Seville.
Mild autumn with fewer tourists, excellent time for cultural activities and museum visits. Autumn colors begin to appear in parks.
Public holiday with traditional cemetery visits and special services. Many businesses closed.
Mild autumn continues with good conditions for city exploration. Lower tourist numbers mean better access to popular attractions.
Major film festival featuring premieres, retrospectives, and special events at various venues throughout the city.
Early winter with cooler temperatures but still pleasant for sightseeing. Preparations for Christmas begin.
Early Christmas preparations with decorations appearing throughout the city.
Public holiday commemorating the Spanish Constitution. Many businesses closed.
'Puente' (bridge) holiday period between Constitution Day and Immaculate Conception.
Public holiday with special religious services. Many businesses closed.
Seville's spectacular Christmas lights on major streets and squares feature synchronized light shows and festive decorations.
Public holiday with limited opening hours. Family celebration day.
Post-Christmas period with continued holiday atmosphere, festive decorations throughout the city, and winter sales beginning.
Celebrations throughout the city, particularly in Plaza Nueva, with the tradition of eating 12 grapes at midnight. Many restaurants offer special New Year's dinners.

spring: Semana Santa Processions in Historic Center
autumn: Autumn Colors in María Luisa Park

scoreDescription.1: Poor: Unfavorable conditions, extreme weather, overcrowded or very limited activities
scoreDescription.2: Below Average: Less ideal conditions, possibly unpleasant weather or very low/high tourism (business closures)
scoreDescription.3: Average: Standard conditions, typical weather, moderate to high tourism
scoreDescription.4: Good: Very favorable conditions, pleasant weather, manageable crowds
scoreDescription.5: Excellent: Perfect conditions, special events, ideal weather, moderate crowds
